item.title: Huricane Melissa, Disaster Relief
item.description: After Hurricane Melissa, Brian messaged me on Instagram. He sells me a vision from his friend on a solution. I message them back on Whatsapp. The Problem Jamaica moves slow. We’re reactive. When disasters hit, we respond. We scramble. We do our best with incomplete information. Communities that are popular on IG and TikTok get help. Rural communities get forgotten. That’s not because Jamaicans don’t care. It’s because we lack coordination.

item.title: Somnia: AI meets Dreams
item.description: The ancient Greeks believed dreams were messages from the gods. Freud called them “the royal road to the unconscious.” Modern neuroscience sees them as the brain’s way of processing, consolidating, making sense of chaos. But here’s what fascinates me: dreams are data. Patterns waiting to be found. Your subconscious speaks to you every night in symbols, emotions, recurring themesâ€”and most of us never learn to listen. What if we could analyze dreams the same way we analyze data?
